Author: 246tnt
Content: You can't have any too large metal area.

Author: 246tnt
Content: If you have a very large metal without "holes" and so the "solution" is to add elongated holes in it that are called "slots".

Author: 246tnt
Content: One solution is to not have a solid metal zone, but instead have "pixels" with a small gap between them. Or horizontal/vertical lines like scan lines. Looking at the die without magnification with the naked eye, it will still look solid and uniform (compared to random small slots in an otherwise solid plane).

Author: tholin
Content: Both the Metal5 and Metal4 layers are visible visually. If the slots in Metal5 and Metal4 were horizontally offset from each other, it would look a little better.
